item.title: Potholes all down Abbotts Walk DA7, 3rd August
item.description:
This road surface is appalling. My parents, both blue badge holders have moved here recently for mobility reasons as they bought a bungalow. My dad also has a pacemaker and he has reported his pacemaker jolting when driving down Abbotts Walk. This road needs resurfacing as soon as possible. The whole road is covered in pot holes and uneven surface.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbott's Walk, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 3rd August
item.description:
Due of lack of care from bromley council, on my street there are still leaves from last autumn. Our street never gets cleaned. When we have a have rain water have no refuge and flooding is high likely. Please show a bit of care for us residents and council tax payers and do your jobs properly

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Chase, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lighting bulb out, 2nd August
item.description:
I am writing to report an urgent issue concerning the street lighting on Tatum Street, which is currently out of service, leaving the entire area in complete darkness. This situation poses a significant safety hazard for both pedestrians and motorists, increasing the risk of accidents. This issue should be addressed as soon as possible to ensure the safety and security of all residents in the surrounding area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tatum Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A Bunch of assholes making a lot of noise., 2nd August
item.description:
It’s almost midnight again, which can only mean one thing — another loud, shouty singalong from 4 Hawkshaw Close, SW2 4QT. This has become something of a Saturday/Sunday tradition, with what we assume are enthusiastic (if not tuneful) renditions of songs in Portuguese. Unfortunately, these performances seem better suited to a festival than a quiet residential street. We understand that people like to enjoy themselves, but perhaps there’s a way to celebrate that doesn’t involve shouting songs at full volume while the rest of us are trying to sleep. It’s impressive how consistent they are — week after week, without fail — but this level of noise at nearly midnight is completely unacceptable in a residential area. It would be great if someone could kindly remind the occupants that London homes aren’t soundproofed concert halls, and some of us would rather not have front-row seats every weekend.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hawkshaw Close, Streatham Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road needs cleaning, 2nd August
item.description:
The pavement was cleaned this week following complaints but still not the road. The excuse is always it’s difficult to clean the road because of parked cars. Then please close the road to parking one day or clean it after 3pm when it’s almost empty of cars again. To keep avoiding this is completely unacceptable to the residents. I was told a few years ago this would be done once a fortnight. For a while it was but that’s all stopped again

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hawes Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal street party, 2nd August
item.description:
A bunch of cars parked on the pavements blasting low quality music all day. Litter and illegal parking everywhere.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Murrain Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
